channel.title: Edit the scrolling speed of the credits?
channel.description:
Personally, I love Joel Nielsen's music in Black Mesa... However, there's one song I despise strongly... and that's end credit song #1. Maybe, I hate this song because when I beat Half-Life for the first time in 2003 - and after playing through the entire epic game... the cliff-hanger that you were left with at the end was one of the most epic cliff-hangers I've ever seen (including movies).
So when the amazing end credits music by Kelly Bailey started playing... I got chills down my spine. The perfect song, for the perfect ending to the game. I sat there in awe as the credits scrolled across the screen... amazed by the fact that it felt so epic. Half-Life was the first game I ever played that made me feel like I was the main character, and that I had, personally, beaten nihilanth, and that I had personally survived the resonance cascade at Black Mesa.
To honor that original feeling - I edited the credits song of BM to the original Kelly Bailey song, and mixed it with Joel Nielsen's end credits part 2 song. There's only one problem... The music is cut off (around) 10 seconds before it's supposed to end. And therefore... that kind of ruins the experience... :frowning:
So can anyone tell me which files I should edit to make it so the credits scroll a little slower? Thanks everyone!
P.S I also edited in the original alarm (instead of the school bell type ring) to the original 'Alien-like' siren. I also put the original Fire Door closing warning sound beep back in, but other than that - everything else is perfect :wink:
At the moment - I'm also attempting to mix the original HEV charge and Med-Charge 'initiate' sounds with the new sounds. If I can get that done and change the above - I'd post that for other who want to do the same :slight_smile:

item.title: Edit the scrolling speed of the credits?
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
You could try adding some escape characters to the end of the credits before the final line of text. I don’t know if that will change the speed or just make everything go a bit faster, though. Worth a try.
The file is scripts/credits.txt, there should also be some additional parameters you can try modifying.

Read full topic

item.title: Edit the scrolling speed of the credits?
item.dc:creator: BuzzKillington
item.description:
Flatline:

What a ridiculous thing to complain about. I don’t think you’re going to be able to do that. When part 2 is released there’ll be a whole new ending and whole new set of credits anyway.

My understanding of the entire point of Black Mesa is to relive the Half-Life experience. That’s all I’m trying to do. Relive a part of my childhood.
